title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7202.4 - Designation of privacy compliance officer
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7202.4 - Designation of privacy compliance officer

State Regulations
(a) The
following person has been designated as privacy compliance officer to the
commission: Records Access Officer, New York State Commission of Correction, Alfred E. Smith State Office Building, 80 S. Swan Street, 12th Floor, Albany, NY 12210-8001. (b) The privacy
compliance officer shall ensure compliance with the Personal Privacy Protection

Law in accordance with the provisions of this Part. (c) The privacy compliance officer shall: (1)
assist a data subject in identifying and
requesting personal information, if necessary; (2)
take one of the following actions upon
locating the record sought: (i) make the
record available for inspection, in a printed form without codes or symbols, unless an accompanying document explaining such codes or symbols is also
provided; or
(ii)
deny access to
the records in whole or in part, and explain in writing the reasons
therefor; (3)

Upon
request for copies of records: (i) make a
copy available upon payment or offer of payment of fees required pursuant to
section
7202.13
of this Part; or
(ii)
permit the requestor to copy these
records; (4)
upon
request, certify that a record is a true copy; and
(5)
upon failure to locate records, certify
that: (i) the commission is not the custodian
for such records; (ii)
the
commission cannot locate the record after having made a diligent search; or
(iii)
the information sought
cannot be retrieved by use of the description thereof, or by use of the name or
other identifier of the data subject without extraordinary search methods being
employed by the commission. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
7202.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
